intro: Oenanthe hortorum-natantium, commonly known as the water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist soils and is often found near streams, ditches, and marshy areas. Due to its preference for wet habitats, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting aquatic ecosystems.
